slides.notes: Greetings fellow historians. Today we look back at the chaotic dawn of the AI age through the lens of a framework called 'Tauri'.

slides.title: The Vessel of Tauri
slides.subtitle: Bridging the Metal and the Glass

content: 'Tauri' was believed to be a ritualistic bridge between the 'Metal' (Rust backend) and the 'Glass' (React frontend).
It enabled 'Webview' manifestations, allowing lightweight spirits to inhabit heavy machines.
Used to house 'Sidecars', which were smaller, auxiliary AI deities accompanying the main consciousness.

slides.notes: The ancients feared the weight of 'Electron', and so they built the 'Vessel of Tauri' to remain agile in the digital aether.

slides.title: The Glass UI Rituals
slides.subtitle: Transparency as a Primitive Ideal

content: Archeologists found 'Themes' (charcoal_fire, emerald_night) using a technique called 'Glassmorphism'.
These semi-transparent 'Cards' were likely an attempt to make the machine feel less opaque to its human users.
Use of 'Geist Mono' typography indicates a reverence for the 'Code' itself as an aesthetic.

slides.notes: Even then, they sought to see through the interface into the logic beneath, though they were still limited by two-dimensional light-emitting diodes.
